summary: Chicago used ChiBlockBuilder, with CBRE Group, Inc.'s assessments, to offer vacant land for Urban Agriculture. NeighborSpace, a non-profit, was chosen to buy the $93,564-valued lots for $1.00 each. The sale, managed by community members post-transfer, was approved by the City Council, with the Mayor, City Clerk, and the Commissioner of the Department authorized to execute the transaction.
